name: Family Dollar
about:
When it comes to getting value for everyday items for the entire family in an easy to shop, neighborhood location, Family Dollar is the best place to go. One of the nation‚Äôs fastest growing retailers, Family Dollar offers a compelling assortment of merchandise for the whole family ranging from household cleaners to name brand foods, from health and beauty aids to toys, from apparel for every age to home fashions, all for everyday low prices. While shoppers can find many items at $1 or less, most items in the store are priced below $10, which makes shopping fun without stretching the family budget.

As shoppers enter their neighborhood Family Dollar, they‚Äôll find great values on the name brands they trust in a clean, well-organized store staffed with friendly team members who are members of the local community. The average size of a Family Dollar store is approximately 7,000 square feet, and most stores are operated in leased facilities. This relatively small footprint allows the Company to open new stores in rural areas and small town, as well as in large urban neighborhoods. Within these markets, the stores are located in shopping centers or as free-standing building and all are convenient to the Company‚Äôs customer base.

Family Dollar offers a compelling mix of merchandise for the whole family. Ranging from an expanded assortment of refrigerated and frozen foods and health and beauty items to home d√©cor and seasonal items, Family Dollar offers the lowest possible price, the name brand and quality private-brand merchandise customers need and use every day.Show moreShow less

about:
As the largest nonprofit health system in the Mountain West, Intermountain Health is dedicated to creating healthier communities and helping our patients and caregivers thrive.   

It‚Äôs time to think of health in a whole new way, and by partnering with our patients and communities, providing expert care closer to home, and making great health more affordable, we can help more people get and stay well.  We proudly invest back into improving the care we deliver, and our pioneering research is making healthcare more personalized, effective, and affordable. 

Serving patients and communities throughout the Mountain West, primarily in Colorado, Utah, Montana, Nevada, Idaho, and Wyoming, Intermountain includes 34 hospitals, 400+ clinics, a medical group, affiliate networks, homecare, telehealth, health insurance plans, and other services - along with wholly owned subsidiaries including Select Health, Castell, Tellica Imaging, and Classic Air Medical.

updates.text:
We are better together ‚Äî especially when we‚Äôre celebrating!
¬†
We asked our caregivers to share their favorite work holiday traditions, and the responses show how we spread joy and togetherness for our coworkers and patients.¬† 

Article written by:Michelle Kaiser#WeAreBetterTogether#TogetherForTheHealthiestLives

Continuous improvement is everywhere.¬†Just because something works doesn't mean it can't be improved upon further. Intermountain Health's Continuous Improvement team in Nevada aims to foster that mentality in our future healthcare leaders through its internship program withUniversity of Nevada-Las Vegas(UNLV). 

The CI internship is a non-paid program that selects students mostly from primary health care schools to learn the core continuous improvement concepts (and earn school credits).¬†The internship includes a fundamentals course, certification/training, and project experience. The program accepts three cohorts each year (spring, summer, and fall). Continuous Improvement directorRyan Hicks, MBAand GME program manager Veronica Tomlinson regularly visit UNLV for recruitment.

Continuous Improvement consultantsLisa Taroneand Adrina Hines help the interns comprehend continuous improvement's place in healthcare, using the tools and methodologies needed to problem-solve and work together as a team.¬†"Through the internship, they are exposed to current barriers in healthcare leadership and participate in building systems to overcome those barriers. The real life, hands-on experience compliments the lessons they have completed in the classroom," said Lisa. 

"One semester never feels like long enough for all the learning that can take place, but we are always happy to see our students graduate and move on to amazing careers in healthcare," Adrina added. "It is rewarding for Lisa and I to mentor the student interns and see them use the skills and knowledge they have gained in their professions. 

Hear from three former interns, including two current Intermountain employees, on how this program benefited their personal and professional lives. 

Article written by:Joseph Gaccione#TogetherForTheHealthiestLives

It‚Äôs a testament toCasey Leavitt‚Äôs commitment to her own physical health that she completed an ambitious course of 18 hikes this summer.  As executive director of the Musculoskeletal Clinical Program at Intermountain Health, she‚Äôs also dedicated her career to the physical health of others. 

Learn what she‚Äôs most proud of in that role (and her favorite hikes).

Article written by:Jef Otte#TogetherForTheHealthiestLives

The first-ever White House Initiative on Women‚Äôs Health Research, launched in 2023, allocated nearly $1 billion in funding from a variety of federal agencies to improving women‚Äôs health across the country. Last week, the President and First Lady invited a select group of women‚Äôs health advocates, clinicians, researchers, experts, investors and philanthropists to the White House to celebrate the program‚Äôs success. Intermountain Health‚Äôs Audrey Jiricko, MD, was among them. 

Dr. Jiricko has played a key role in advancing women‚Äôs health at Intermountain. As an obstetrician-gynecologist, she helped activate intimate partner violence screening and pioneer the integration of mental health screening in the OB-GYN setting. Aside from improving patients‚Äô health and safety, these practices recognize the holistic scope of women‚Äôs health issues and challenges.  

As senior medical director of Women‚Äôs Health in the Canyons region, she also collaborated across disciplines to promote best practices in women‚Äôs health, recently leading the creation of Intermountain‚Äôs first Women‚Äôs Heart Health Program.  

It‚Äôs all work that embodied the spirit of the White House Initiative on Women‚Äôs Health, which President Biden said at the event is intended to ‚Äúfundamentally change and improve how we invest in women‚Äôs health.‚Äù  

For Dr. Jiricko, it was a reminder that the work she‚Äôs led and continues to lead at Intermountain really does make a difference. 

‚ÄúEvery time I attend a national event like this, I appreciate Intermountain even more,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre doing great research, but we‚Äôre also operationalizing those best practices to deliver excellent care to our patients. Our focus on becoming a model health system brings it all together.‚Äù

Baby deliveries don‚Äôt always come on schedule, and in two recent instances, expectant moms didn‚Äôt even make it into the hospital in time. 

However, caregivers at Riverton Hospital in Riverton, Utah and McKay-Dee Hospital in Ogden, Utah were unfazed and responded to the parking lot to accomplish safe deliveries.¬† 

Article written by:Lance Frazier#TogetherForTheHealthiestLives

A couple of years ago, patients needing birth control could wait up to 10 weeks to see an OB/GYN or nurse midwife due to a shortage of appointments and industry-wide access issues. 

During a tour of the Intermountain Health Home Delivery Pharmacy,Matthew Wells MD, MBA, medical director of women‚Äôs health, and chief pharmacy officerCarrie Dunfordbrainstormed how they could use Intermountain‚Äôs Home Delivery model to address this consumer experience and access challenge.

Read more here:https://lnkd.in/gJrpkjY9Article written by:Erin Hakoda, APR#Innovation#TogetherForTheHealthiestLives

A Salt Lake man, who is a veteran runner and marathoner, is thankful to be alive after suffering cardiac arrest at the St. George Marathon on Oct. 5. 

Dan Sorensen has run many marathons himself, but this time he and his son were there just to support and encourage friends during the last few miles of the St. George Marathon. 

At mile 23, Dan and his son, Oliver Sorensen began running alongside their friend for a short time when Dan suddenly collapsed and fell to the ground. His son turned him over and found his dad unresponsive, his heart had stopped, and he had injuries to his face and knees.
 
Almost immediately, two Intermountain Health caregivers, Mike Henstrom, MD, an emergency medicine physician, at Intermountain Medical Center, and Julie Street, RN, nurse manager of the Intermountain Saratoga Springs emergency department, who were running in the marathon behind them, arrived upon the scene and jumped into action along with Katie Bradshaw Smith, RN, an emergency room nurse with MountainStar St. Mark‚Äôs Hospital who was also running in the marathon.

Dan and his family reunited with these caregivers in late November at Intermountain Medical Center in Murray, for the first time since the incident.
 
‚ÄúThere are compassionate people and then there are skilled, compassionate people. It‚Äôs an interesting perspective to be the guy that was down on the road, and for people who were there to run a race, to sacrifice their time and use their medical skills during what were very critical moments for me. They gave me the chance to keep living. That‚Äôs pretty telling of the kind of people they are,‚Äù Dan added.

Feeling the strain from hunching over your personal device? Coach Alicia fromSkechershas a quick and effective stretch to bring you some relief!
¬†
Step about a foot away from a wall and lean back until the back of your head touches the wall.
¬†
Push the back of your head gently, lifting your body away from the wall, hold for 3 seconds, and release.
¬†
Repeat two more times for a simple yet powerful reset.
¬†
In just a few seconds, you‚Äôll feel the tension melt away.
¬†
Stay active, stay healthy, and keep stretching with us at Skechers!#SkechFit#Wellness#WorkplaceWellness#StayActive

SkechersHonored With the Icon Award for Social Impact at the Footwear News Achievement Awards!

The FNAA highlighted the Company‚Äôs multifaceted range of causes, which includes raising $28 million through the Skechers Pier to Pier Friendship Walk, California‚Äôs largest annual walk for neurodiverse children and education; launching the BOBS¬Æ¬†from Skechers¬Æ¬†philanthropic brand that has given new shoes to 16 million children in need globally and helped 2.2 million shelter animals; and donating millions to support disaster-impacted communities around the world.

‚ÄúThe FNAA‚Äôs Social Impact award was born out of the idea that a great brand cannot be judged solely by the success of its business, but the impact it also leaves on future generations,‚Äù said Michael Atmore, Editorial Director of¬†Footwear News¬†and Chief Brand Officer for Fairchild Fashion Media.

‚ÄúThough we have given back since our early days, we came together as a company to aid Hurricane Katrina families in 2005, and help children with special needs in our community,‚Äù said Michael Greenberg, President of Skechers and Co-Founder of the Skechers Pier to Pier Friendship Walk.

SkechersCelebrates Giving Tuesday With $12 Million Donation Milestone for Animals in Need!

This Giving Tuesday, Skechers celebrates its latest charitable milestone: reaching $12 million in total donations since the inception of its philanthropic BOBS¬Æ¬†from Skechers¬Æ¬†collection in 2015. Through sales of the BOBS brand, Skechers contributions have now helped save and support more than 2.2 million shelter pets across the United States, Canada, the U.K. and Japan.

‚ÄúLike so many of the animals we‚Äôve helped save, our BOBS from Skechers journey has taken us to surprising, emotional and joyous places these past nine years,‚Äù said Michael Greenberg, President of Skechers.

‚ÄúFrom supporting our lifesaving mission to celebrating our Love Stories winners and recipient animal welfare partner organizations, Skechers has been there to honor the joys that come with saving lives,‚Äù added Susanne Kogut, President of national non-profit organization Petco Love.

Feeling tightness in your back or dealing with sciatic issues from sitting too long? Coach Alicia fromSkechershas the perfect solution!
¬†
Follow along as she demonstrates a simple yet effective stretch you can do right from your chair in under 60 seconds.
¬†
Step 1: Sit tall with a nice, long spine. Take a big breath in.
Step 2: Lift your right foot, placing your ankle on top of your left thigh.
Step 3: Stack your arms like a genie, gently rotating toward the bent knee while keeping your spine long.
¬†
Hold for 5-10 seconds, then switch sides!
¬†
Repeat this stretch 2-3 times on each side to release tension and help your lower back feel amazing.
¬†
Stay active, stay healthy, and keep stretching with us at Skechers!#SkechFit#Wellness#WorkplaceWellness#StayActive

With vibrant paints, an amazing taco truck (hello, horchata!), and the perfect playlist, the afternoon was filled with laughing, bonding, and idea-sharing in a space that fueled both creativity and connection.

When we encourage our teams to think outside the box, they‚Äôre able to innovate, collaborate, and create the kind of footwear that brings joy to millions.

Here‚Äôs to many more moments of team bonding and sparking creativity together!

name: Microsoft
about:
Every company has a mission. What's ours? To empower every person and every organization to achieve more. We believe technology can and should be a force for good and that meaningful innovation contributes to a brighter world in the future and today. Our culture doesn‚Äôt just encourage curiosity; it embraces it. Each day we make progress together by showing up as our authentic selves. We show up with a learn-it-all mentality. We show up cheering on others, knowing their success doesn't diminish our own. We show up every day open to learning our own biases, changing our behavior, and inviting in differences. Because impact matters. 

Microsoft operates in 190 countries and is made up of approximately 228,000 passionate employees worldwide.

updates.text:
From creating meal plans to making history more accessible, discover how AI is turning the once unimaginable into reality in December‚Äôs edition of The Monthly Tech-In. üí°¬†
This month, we‚Äôll explore how we‚Äôre merging technology with tradition and share insights on where AI might be heading in 2025.

The other day, Marc Benioff made a comment that caught my attention: ‚ÄúMicrosoft isn‚Äôt using Copilot themselves.‚Äù I love his passion. But it‚Äôs just not true. 
¬†
I use Copilot. My team uses Copilot. And pretty much all of Microsoft has been actively using Copilot for two years. That's 100s of thousands of us!
¬†
A few months ago, we even compiled several stories about Copilot‚Äôs impact at Microsoft:https://lnkd.in/gZtxsxexWe built an agent in Copilot Studio forAzure.comwhich was deployed before Agentforce was even announced. It boosted engagement 4.75x and drove a 21.5% increase in conversion rates! 
¬†
On our sales team, Copilot is providing a 9.4%¬†increase in revenue per seller and a 20%¬†increase in close rates among high users of the tool. 
¬†
Copilot is benefiting customer support response by helping to resolve cases, with one team closing cases 12%¬†faster.
¬†
From a marketing perspective, Copilot has helped us improve the digital customer experience and accelerated campaign creation from 12 weeks to 3 weeks.
¬†
Copilot is helping our legal team respond to issues 32%¬†faster.¬†Our HR department has seen a 42% increase in employee self-service answer accuracy when using Copilot.
¬†
And those are just a few examples! I always appreciate Marc‚Äôs takes and he is always welcome to ask me how else Microsoft is transforming with AI. Or he can ask Copilot üòä.
¬†
We have a lot more coming in 2025, and I cannot wait to tell you all about it! This is such an exciting time for us, our customers, partners, and the industry. 
¬†
Cheers to the New Year and Happy Holidays to everyone!

2024 was a turning point for#AI. In just one year, we‚Äôve gone from chatbots crafting essays to AI becoming an integral part of our daily workflows. With advancements like multimodal AI and AI agents transforming business processes, the impact of this technology is clearer than ever.¬†
¬†
2025 promises to take this momentum even further. We‚Äôll see smarter ways of working with AI, exciting breakthroughs in hardware, and innovations that continue to reshape industries.¬†
¬†
Join me in exploring what‚Äôs ahead in my latest AI at Work newsletter.#FutureOfWork#AITrends

GitHub Copilot Free for VS Code has arrived.

Sign up today:https://lnkd.in/gdAcfCnm

The pace of AI innovation this past year has been truly remarkable. But looking back, what stands out most is the incredible speed at which this technology has diffused, turning innovation into real impact‚Äîone person, one organization, one community at a time. 

And throughout 2024, I had the privilege of witnessing countless examples of this around the world.

AI is empowering radiologists, streamlining workflows, and improving patient care. Explore how Microsoft is advancing healthcare through responsible AI innovation‚Äîplus highlights from RSNA 2024:https://msft.it/6042ouyFm

Cyberattacks are evolving rapidly, but so is the technology to stop them. At Microsoft, we‚Äôre harnessing AI to analyze massive datasets, detect hidden patterns, and enable proactive responses‚Äîhelping both our systems and organizations around the world stay ahead of even the most sophisticated threats. 

AI is transforming cybersecurity by shifting it from reactive defense to proactive strategy. With smarter tools and actionable insights, our security teams can predict, detect, and respond to attacks with precision, shaping a safer digital future. 

Discover how AI is redefining cybersecurity and protecting critical systems in the 2024 Microsoft Digital Defense Report:https://msft.it/6046oEBX4#MDDR#Cybersecurity#AI#AIForGood
Devin, the AI software engineer fromCognition, is now generally available, powered byMicrosoft Azure. Azure customers can access Devin today on the Azure marketplace:https://msft.it/6048o3GYe

Today, we are happy to announce that our next-generation datacenter designs now use zero water for cooling. By adopting chip-level cooling technology, Microsoft is eliminating water evaporation and avoiding the need for 125 million liters of water per datacenter annually.
¬†
This innovation aligns with our Datacenter Community Pledge, protecting local watersheds and reducing our Water Usage Effectiveness to near zero. Together, we‚Äôre paving the way for a more sustainable future.
¬†
Learn more about our zero-water cooling technology:#MSFTAdvocate#MSSustainability

updates.text: You knew it was coming üëÄ: Here, the stories from 2024 that show the power of sport, the excellence of our athletes and our brand's role in helping them perform at their best.

A three-time MVP. A two-time league champion. Only one A'ja Wilson. 

Get inside the head of one of the greatest to ever play the game:https://lnkd.in/gidx-u4y#NikeBasketball#JustDoIt

At Nike, we don‚Äôt just create products ‚Äî we push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible. Every idea, big or small, is a step toward the unimaginable. It‚Äôs not about playing it safe; it‚Äôs about constantly evolving and meeting the needs that haven‚Äôt even been thought of yet.Carrie McKnelly, Senior Digital Design Innovator, puts it best: "This is art, this is science, all coming together to make a beautiful object."

Let your curiosity and passion help us redefine the future of sport.

Innovate with us:jobs.nike.com#JustDoIt#SwooshLife#NikeDesign

The defining athlete of the year ‚Äî and no doubt years to come. Congratulations toTIMEMagazine‚Äôs 2024 Athlete of the Year, Caitlin Clark, who inspired and invigorated communities in and out of sport.
¬†
‚ÄúWith her incredible athleticism, focus and determination, Caitlin has evolved the sports conversation from a binary women and men‚Äôs dynamic to a celebration of basketball and what makes it great, reminding us all why we love the game,‚Äù saysAmy Melczer Montagne, VP/GM Nike Women, who gathered with Nike teammates and athletes at the TIME gala in New York City to honor Caitlin. ‚ÄúWitnessing this pivotal moment, here with our Nike¬†team, is a reminder of the singular experiences of working at this brand and the unmatched energy they give you.‚Äù
¬†
Get more behind-the scenes looks and interviews with our Nike athletes:https://about.nike.com/en/#JustDoIt#SwooshLife#NikeBasketball

It was a window into the future. On December 7, more than 400 of the country‚Äôs best distance runners traveled to Portland, Ore., for the Nike Cross Nationals (NXN) Finals. NXN is the pinnacle high school cross-country showcase in the United States, and individual runners and clubs from eight regional championships went head to head, leaving it all on the course to be crowned National Champion. Many of the top finishers of NXN grow into accomplished¬†pro runners, winning national championships, international medals ‚Äî even Olympic gold.
¬†
In the middle of the action that weekend wasCameron ‚ÄúCam‚Äù Yates, Brand Manager, North America, Nike Running. He says that his team gets to ‚Äúbring high school running to life in the United States,‚Äù and they cut no corners in making NXN the most thrilling race experience possible for the competitors, right down to the color of the course markers and the graphic treatment of the finish line.
¬†
‚ÄúI found running later in my life,‚Äù says Cam, who grew up playing baseball and soccer. ‚ÄúAfter putting on meets like this, I get to see how supportive the running community is toward each other. You especially see that during NXN, with how the pros travel here on race day to encourage the high school runners. For these high school kids, a big part of their experience is shaped by seeing these accomplished runners who they admire, and who‚Äôve competed in this race themselves, cheering them on. They‚Äôll remember it for the rest of their lives. It‚Äôs inspiring to me that I get to help create an experience like this.‚Äù

Check out more behind-the-scenes photos from race day:https://lnkd.in/gGbNJeRh#NikeRunning#NXN2024#NikeCrossNationals

The products we build at Nike are the culmination of thousands of single decisions made in unison from our teammates and aligned to a shared vision. Together, we‚Äôre committed to changing the future of sport. This purpose makes it impossible to not bring our absolute best to each decision we make.

For Charles Han, Senior Footwear Designer, world-class design is built on this process, which he says "is about hearing the feedback, feeling the feedback and then acting on the feedback.‚Äù Design here is a conversation. We listen. We learn. We uncover what's next for sport.

After a two-hour ride with Nike teammates, Demi sat down for a Q&A session, where employees got to hear how Demi started her professional career, what it means to be a role model in women‚Äôs cycling and the impact she wants to make in the world.
